Welcome to Hanabi’s documentation!¶

Contents:

Introduction¶

This package plays Hanabi, the best card game ever.

The sources are on Github here: https://github.com/JDGaraudEnsta/hanabi

Module reference¶

Release:0.1.0
Date:Apr 16, 2019
hanabi.deck Hanabi deck and game engine.
hanabi.ai Artificial Intelligence to play Hanabi.

hanabi.deck¶

Hanabi deck and game engine.

class hanabi.deck.Card(color=None, number=None)¶
str_clue()¶

What I know about this card.

str_color()¶

Colorized string for this card.

class hanabi.deck.Color¶

Card colors. Int values correspond to xterm’s.

Blue = 34¶
Green = 32¶
Red = 31¶
White = 37¶
Yellow = 33¶
colorize(*args)¶

Colorize the given string

class hanabi.deck.Deck(cards=None)¶
card_count = {1: 3, 2: 2, 3: 2, 4: 2, 5: 1}¶
cards_by_player = {2: 5, 3: 5, 4: 4, 5: 4}¶
deal(nhands)¶

Deal n hands and return them.

Draw a card from the deck.

class hanabi.deck.Game(players=2, multi=False)¶
Players = ('Alice', 'Benji', 'Clara', 'Dante', 'Elric')¶
add_blue_coin()¶
add_red_coin()¶
clue(clue)¶

Action: give a clue.

command(args)¶

Action: Run a python command from Hanabi (yes, it is a cheat code: self is the current Game).

discard(index)¶

Action: Discard the given card from current hand (the first if index is an empty string).

examine_piles(*unused)¶

Action: look at the table.

load(filename)¶

Load a saved game, replay the moves.

A saved game consists of the variables players, cards and moves.

next_player()¶

Switch to next player.

play(index)¶

Action: play the given card.

print_piles()¶
remove_blue_coin()¶
reset(players=2, multi=False, cards=None)¶

Reset this game.

run()¶
save(filename)¶

Save starting deck and list of moves.

score¶
turn(_choice=None)¶

Play one round: ask the player what she wants to do, then update the game. If _choice is not None, play it instead of asking.

Note: If provided, _choice can be:

  • None: the human will be prompted
  • a (str), which is played
  • an AI object (we will play what its function play() suggests)
  • a list of actions, because I chose to record invalid actions too (and these loop within this file).
class hanabi.deck.Hand(deck, n=5)¶
append(c)¶
pop(i)¶

Pop a card from the hand, and draw a new one.

hanabi.ai¶

Artificial Intelligence to play Hanabi.

class hanabi.ai.AI(game)¶

AI base class: some basic functions, game analysis.

class hanabi.ai.BigBrain(game)¶

A player set to become the best of all

play()¶
class hanabi.ai.Cheater(game)¶

This player can see his own cards!

Algorithm:
  • if 1-or-more card is playable: play the lowest one, then newest one
  • if blue_coin<8 and an unnecessary card present: discard it.
  • if blue_coin>0: give a clue on precious card (so a human can play with a Cheater)
  • if blue_coin<8: discard the largest one, except if it’s the last of its kind or in chop position in his opponent.
play()¶

Return the best cheater action.

class hanabi.ai.Random(game)¶

Plays randomly, but take in account the number of blue coins

play()¶
hanabi.ai.getrandbits(k) → x. Generates an int with k random bits.¶
hanabi.ai.random() → x in the interval [0, 1).¶
